title: Would I have gotten an S for this game?
body:
If my team didn't FF, never knew FF'ing decreases your chances of getting an S.

23/7/8  with 234 minion kills - Top lane?

replies.body:
Probably not, no. a key factor you left out was game length. 234 cs in a 48 minute game isn't good.
Where did you see that surrendering will lower your grade?

> [{quoted}](name=dynikus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UjyPqLaE,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-01-26T04:41:48.893+0000)
>
> Probably not, no. a key factor you left out was game length. 234 cs in a 48 minute game isn't good.
> Where did you see that surrendering will lower your grade?

Yeah I agree with this. You should try to shoot for at least 7 cs a minute. Objectives help with ratings too.

The algorithims for determining grade are secret, so only rioters on that team would be able to tell you.

That said. Based on current theories going around, you haven't provided enough information to make an informed guess.
Loosing a game decreases it, but i have personally gotten a few S and S+ ranks in lost games. It depends more on what champion you are playing.
Stop FF there really no reason to unless the opposing team is just statpadding

WAIT-WHAT?! IT DOES??? I think you would have.
I've had a bunch of scores like 21/2 and above that, but my teams try to surrender like 6 times per match. I'm upset now! Riot's trying to fuck up everyone!
